Project Director: Programs for disadvantaged
National Educational Radio
1346 Connecticut Avenue N.W.
Washington D.C. 20036
Dear Mr. Clark:
Let me first apologize for the lateness of this response to
your letter of June 27. We at WAUP are highly encouraged.by_
your comments, and find many potential benefits in our mutual
association.
To the points of your request:
WAUP has aired the following .-Urban-related programs, and they_
are available in our —---
A lecture by Dr. Daniel P. Moynihan, director of the Center j-or
Urban Studies of Harvard and M.I.T. called "City in Chassis"
(@24:00)
A Press Conference held by Dr. Moynihan on the day of his lecture,
December 6, 1967. (30:00)
A Lecture/panel discussion with Dr. James Conant of the Lemberg
Center of Violence at Brandeis University; with response from
a panel of prominent academic, government, and civic leaders
from the Akron area. November 29, 1967 (60:00)
A lecture by Whitney M. Young, executive director of the National
Urban League Inc. on January 28, 1968 - "The Current Dilemma:
Challenge and opportunity". (30:00)
A News Special on the dedication of the "Old Stone School" (c.1870)
to be used by Akron elementary school students in studying
